meanings.definition: Talk in a loud, aggressive, or indignant way with little effect.
meanings.sent1: The politician would often bluster during his speeches to seem powerful.
meanings.sent2: Don't be fooled by his blustering; he rarely follows through on his promises.
meanings.sent3: The little dog would bluster at the mailman every morning, thinking he was intimidating.
meanings.sent4: Her blustering about quitting her job was just a cry for attention.
meanings.sent5: The storm continued to bluster outside, but inside the house was warm and cozy.

meanings.definition: A loud, aggressive, or indignant noise.
meanings.sent1: The bluster of the wind outside made it hard to sleep.
meanings.sent2: His bluster could be heard from across the room, demanding attention.
meanings.sent3: The bluster of the toddler's tantrum echoed through the grocery store.
meanings.sent4: The bluster of the waterfall drowned out all other sounds in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The bluster of the thunderstorm was both frightening and awe-inspiring.
